column3:
I'm following the payment request testplan: https://github.com/gavinandresen/QA/blob/master/PaymentRequestTest.md

"Unsigned payment request"
- OK

"Signed payment request"
- OK

"Signed payment request, multiple addresses"
- Overview is correct, sent transactions are correct
- Strange: no label is added for the second address when doing this. Not sure this is a regression though.

"Pa
I didn't try to compile, but you can get a looked-at-the-code ACK. We should merge and improve the rest afterwards.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/9e8904f6aeb6e98b4781fcf408b0a2bee550051d for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
This should be changed to dynamic units via `model->getOptionsModel()->getDisplayUnit()`, remember my recent pull :).\n
I'm not sure if we should use fixed font-sizes.\n
Is this still used anywhere after this pull?\n
Yes. We should use that. @laanwj should i takeover again and fix these things?\n
Hmm... i would keep the current font. Even with fixed font's line breaks are possible.\nI also think fixed fonts can look really bad.\n
I think it's still used when you submit transactions over RPC.\n
This was also in @jonasschnelli's pull, which I just rebased. We can keep font improvements for a future pull.\n
@jonasschnelli I'd rather just get this merged ASAP and leave improvements to later. So if there's nothing breaking or obviously incorrect I'd like to get ACKs.\n
